result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Bail Bond Forfeiture (defendant) - Return to Sender; not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward
E-filing notice "Return to Sender; not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward" handwritten "Return to sender not at this address"
Notice of bond forfeiture - "return to sender-attempted not known - unable to forward"
to forfeit bond
for Withdrawal
Extradition Forecast-Will extradite

8:40 a.m.  Defendant does not appear. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf55 and 15cf54. Bennett - it has been 2 weeks since he has talked to client; there was an incident of domestic violence since then and has had no contact. Michlig- new charges have been filed - warrant has been issued on new charges. Court authorizes warrant in these matters. Bennett - motion to withdraw from 15cf55 and 15cf54 - denied, but taken under advisement. Adj. 8:42 a.m.

Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:49
Stipulation to 15cf55 going forward first as trial then 15cf54 to follow   victim case to be tried first

2:48 p.m. Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55. Bennett statement that cases are not resolved - requests jury trial for 15cf54. 15cf55 set for status conference to track with 15cf54. Adj. 2:52 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

1:38 p.m. Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.   Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55.  Bennett states defendant has scheduled psychological evaluation which will be pertinent to any negotiations/PSI - requests date for jury trial or pre-trial conference. Michlig statement to pretrial date. Adj. 1:41 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued

3:38 p.m. Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55 - In receipt of Information - waive reading - enters not guilty plea - Bail continued. Adj. 3:40 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Adj. 3:41 p.m.
Arraignment at 09-14-2015 03:00 pm
PC from Jonathon - in WMHF- unable to leave - has contacted attorney Bennetts office and informed them that he will not able to be in court Monday

Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Calling 15cf54 - Court will proceed with 15cf54 first

Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bennett statement to court regarding defendant not in court and states reasons and asks for court to reschedule.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.

PC from Mr. Mason - Tried to get in LE Phillips or other facilites and was advised by those facilities that they will not treat him based on a phone call from a Detective from the Rhinelander PD..along with his doctor being notified to cut off his meds.   feels this is a violation of rights  Needs treatment bad - his PD is not calling him back - advised him to contact Public Defender's office directly.

Includes 15cf55.  No contact stricken from bond;   Court will allow release for inpatient treatment if unable to post bond .  Must either be in jail or inpatient treatment if unable to post bond.  Must be in a secure facility

Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court via video  with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Includes 15cf55.  No contact WHATSOEVER  with Laura Kennedy.  Court will allow release for inpatient treatment if unable to post bond .  Must either be in jail or inpatient treatment if unable to post bond.  Must be in a secure facility
